result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve L. Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steve L. Sutton in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Defendant Steve L. Sutton in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 86.  1:35 PM  State recites appearances.  State recites recommendation 13 CF 113 - count 5 and 1, 2,3, 4 and 6 DRI - 14 CF 86 .    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE entered NC plea to count 5 in 13 CF 113 and 14 CF 86.  Court finds defendant guilty 13 CF 113 count 5 and 14 CF 86 - Counts 1,2,3,4 and 6 in 13 CF 113 are dismissed and read-in.  Atty McClain agrees with recitation by the State. 

COURT:  13 CF 113 - 8 years prison - 4 years incarcerated credit for 228  days time served and 4 years ES - Costs - DNA sample/surcharge - restitution if requested - counseling as recommended by doc - Counts 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 are dismissed and read-in.  Eligible for Substance Abuse

14 CF 86 4 years prison - 2 years incarcerated Concurrent with 13 CF 113 credit for 228 days time served and 2 years ES concurrent to 13 CF 113 - Costs - DNA sample/surcharge - counseling as recommended by DOC - Eligible for Substance Abuse
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steve L. Sutton in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  Defendant Steve L. Sutton in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  DE does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim and finds probable cause to bind the defendant over for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Steve L. Sutton in court via video with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore via phone.  Defendant Steve L. Sutton in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court recites complaint.   Atty Larimore advised his client to waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions defendant and advised him as to his rights.  Defendant waived time limits for preliminary exam.  Court finds defendant freely waived time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Not to possess/consume any alcohol.  Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises (no bars/liquor stores).  Absolute sobriety.
Not to possess/consume any alcohol.  Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises (no bars/liquor stores).  Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Steve L. Sutton in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests $2500.00 cash bond for both cases.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
